meanings.definition: Appearing to be true or real
meanings.sent1: The sky's blue color is seeming on a sunny day.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was seeming as she greeted her friends.
meanings.sent3: The magician's seeming ability to make objects disappear amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The forest's seeming silence hid the chirping of hidden birds.
meanings.sent5: The old house's seeming hauntedness sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: Having the appearance of being true or real
meanings.sent1: The seeming calmness of the lake belied the strong currents beneath.
meanings.sent2: His seeming indifference masked his true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The seeming ease with which she solved the puzzle surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The seeming endless road stretched out before them.
meanings.sent5: The seeming simplicity of the task turned out to be quite challenging.

meanings.definition: Giving the impression of being true or real
meanings.sent1: The detective's seeming lack of interest was just a facade.
meanings.sent2: The seeming chaos of the room was actually organized chaos.
meanings.sent3: The seeming randomness of the pattern revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: The seeming kindness of the stranger touched her heart.
meanings.sent5: The seeming brightness of the star faded as the clouds rolled in.
